Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Merrythought cup; interior: glazed black with two narrow bands in added red; black on top of flat rim; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of two facing male figures holding spears (of left male head with red hair and beard, part of red himation and hands remain; of that to right head with red hair and beard and one hand); painted inscription between figures.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 41, pl. XXI, no. 14)
Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (p. 62, pl. VIII, no. 7)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 430, no. B687)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1567) (phase 3)
